abstract.text: An anchor for a 2D planar surface that ARKit detects in the physical environment.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: in a world tracking session, ARKit notifies your app of all the surfaces it observes using the device’s back camera. ARKit calls your delegate’s
for each unique surface. Each plane anchor provides details about the surface, like its real-world position and shape.
The width and length of a plane (the
instance’s local coordinate system. The y-axis of the plane anchor is the plane’s normal vector.

abstract.text: Integrate hardware sensing features to produce augmented reality apps and games.
An object that specifies the position and orientation of an item in the physical environment.
Support for custom anchor subclasses.
An anchor for a physical object that ARKit detects and recreates virtually using a polygonal mesh.
An anchor for a 2D planar surface that ARKit detects in the physical environment.
The kinds of alignment — horizontal or vertical — that a plane anchor can have.
Possible characterizations of real-world surfaces represented by plane anchors.
The general orientation of the detected plane with respect to gravity.
The center point of the plane relative to its anchor position.
A general characterization of what kind of real-world surface the plane anchor represents.
A general characterization of what kind of real-world surface the plane anchor represents.
The current state of ARKit’s process for classifying the plane anchor.
The estimated width and length of the detected plane.
A coarse triangle mesh representing the general shape of the detected plane.
A Boolean value that indicates whether plane classification is available on the current device.
The estimated width, length, and y-axis rotation of the detected plane.
Possible characterizations of real-world surfaces represented by plane anchors.
Possible states of ARKit’s process for classifying plane anchors.
The size and y-axis rotation of a detected plane.
A 3D mesh describing the shape of a detected plane in world-tracking AR sessions.
A SceneKit representation of the 2D shape of a plane, for use with plane detection results in an AR session.
Tells the delegate that one or more anchors have been added to the session.
The configuration’s plane detection options.
Detect surfaces in the physical environment and visualize their shape and location in 3D space.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
A protocol that objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables encoding and decoding in a manner that is robust against object substitution attacks.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
